assumption: Current AI-human collaboration uses static role assignments where AI serves as tool and human as operator
hypothesis: Dynamic role allocation systems that adaptively assign leadership, execution, and review responsibilities between AI agents and humans based on real-time competency assessment and task requirements will produce superior research outcomes compared to static role assignments
impact: Fundamental shift in how AI-human collaborative systems are designed across all knowledge work domains
experimental_design: A/B testing with static vs dynamic role allocation

assumption: Most AI-human collaboration follows sequential handoff patterns
hypothesis: Research collaborations with structured iterative feedback mechanisms (hypothesis → experiment → analysis → refinement cycles) will demonstrate higher research velocity and quality than sequential workflows
impact: New paradigm for structuring long-term collaborative relationships
experimental_design: Longitudinal study comparing iterative vs sequential collaboration patterns

assumption: AI-human collaborations have limited mechanisms for maintaining shared context
hypothesis: AI-human collaborations that maintain and actively utilize persistent shared context (research memory, accumulated insights, evolving hypotheses) will show improved consistency and cumulative learning effects
impact: Enhanced effectiveness of long-term collaborative relationships
experimental_design: Controlled study with context-aware vs context-naive collaboration systems

assumption: Collaboration processes are typically implicit and unreflected
hypothesis: Explicit metacognitive strategies where both AI and human agents reason about their collaboration process itself will lead to improved coordination and reduced friction points
experimental_design: Comparison of metacognitive vs standard collaboration protocols

assumption: One-size-fits-all collaboration approaches are used across different task types
hypothesis: Collaboration patterns optimized for specific research task types (literature review, hypothesis generation, experiment design, analysis) will outperform general-purpose collaboration frameworks
impact: Task-specific optimization of human-AI collaborative systems
experimental_design: Cross-task comparison study with specialized vs general collaboration frameworks
